title: BeautifulScarrs
author: BeautifulScarrs
content: Hi everyoneI just need some advice. I run a small business and have customers who want to pay in TruefreedomCoins (TFC)I'm searching everywhere but can find a way to get it to pay out.Is there anyone who has experience who can assist.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: BeautifulScarrs on October 23, 2023, 08:56:23 AMHi everyoneI just need some advice. I run a small business and have customers who want to pay in TruefreedomCoins (TFC)I'm searching everywhere but can find a way to get it to pay out.Is there anyone who has experience who can assist.If it's not tradeable and there is no information about this shitcoin, deny their payment and only go for Bitcoin or other top coins in the market, the market is highly volatile, and accepting unknown coins with no potential is a bad idea you will lose your investment.These people want to dump their shitcoin or in short, they just want to scam you, for a businessman or entrepreneur like you, you should ignore coins that are not in the top 10 the market is highly volatile, and first to lose its value are shitcoin like this TruefreedomCoins (TFC)

comments.author: Pandji02
comments.body: Forget it. If you want to use crypto, use BTC, or ETH. Other options are not that trustable. And most of them are not safe at all, just like that shitcoin.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Quote from: BeautifulScarrs on October 23, 2023, 08:56:23 AM~Are you THAT desperate for customers? If not you can simply reject their purchase or tell them to pay using another method other than their shitcoin. It may be called a currency but it's still up to YOU, the business owner, whether to accept said currencies as payment or not. Can't even find the damn coin in coinmarketcap, says a lot about the coin already just from that. \If you're that desperate though then you might need a change in your business model itself since you, as an owner, should not need to adopt the payment methods of your customers. It should be the other way around really, especially for an unknown coin like this, you shouldn't even bother asking what to do or not really, just decline if they want to force the payment using their shitcoin.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: BeautifulScarrs on October 23, 2023, 08:56:23 AMI run a small business and have customers who want to pay in TruefreedomCoins (TFC)If you are the business owner you might accept only common coins which are familiar with other merchants already. From the sounds of the coin is obviously a shitcoin, would you accept something like this which you dont know if even have value? Its make sense that you avoid dealing with unfamiliar coins or tokens which seems to be suspicious especially if you are doing business.

comments.author: wajik-tempe
comments.body: Dealing with new or dubious currencies, such as coin you mentioned, might definitely bring concerns, such as a lack of acceptance and an undetermined value. Prioritizing security and dependability is critical as a business owner, and it is prudent to use payment methods that are generally accepted in the business community. Established cryptocurrencies such as BTC and ETH are unquestionably safer options.

comments.author: CoinFoxs
comments.body: Quote from: BeautifulScarrs on October 23, 2023, 08:56:23 AMHi everyoneI just need some advice. I run a small business and have customers who want to pay in TruefreedomCoins (TFC)I'm searching everywhere but can find a way to get it to pay out.Is there anyone who has experience who can assist.Don't consider it as a payment method it is a shitcoin and it is not listed on any exchange. Only trade in BTC, ETH, or USDT for such payment purposes. You are newbie so only take payments in the coins i have mentioned above.

comments.author: Gozie51
comments.body: That customer knows he is paying you with shit coin but you don't know because you don't have such knowledge. How will someone pay you in that when btc, usdt are most popular in crypto sells and buy transaction. Stay away from such person they are probably going to cheat you off your money, be wise and use tradable coins.You can use top coins found in CMC or stay with just btc, usdt, eth or BNB.https://coinmarketcap.com/

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Use only liquid coins for business, don't collect all the junk they try to force on you. Your customers want to pay you with low-liquidity garbage that they can't use anywhere else. Use bitcoin, stablecoin or ETH to accept payment, any shitcoins should be ignored.

comments.author: kentrolla
comments.body: Either your customers are frauds or else they are behind this shit coin because I have not heard of them and even if you wish to accept payment in crypto then go for top altcoin which are less volatile or just stick to bitcoin because there is a huge risk involved and I had my hope on one such coin named "Utrust" which has been rebranded as xMoney and this coin solved the issue where you can request payment in crypto and have it deposited as fiat in your account.

comments.author: Shamm
comments.body: Quote from: BeautifulScarrs on October 23, 2023, 08:56:23 AMHi everyoneI just need some advice. I run a small business and have customers who want to pay in TruefreedomCoins (TFC)I'm searching everywhere but can find a way to get it to pay out.Is there anyone who has experience who can assist.It's better if you said to your customers that they pay you in other payment methods they can pay you Bitcoin and ETH instead of  that shitcoin  cause one thing for sure it's hard  to trust that coin as we all know that is not like other trusted  altcoin. But still it's up to you if you will accept but If I were you I don't want to accept it. Anyways in my own  that's shitcoin is not familiar yet in exchange so must better if we secure our side that we loss because of that.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Quote from: BeautifulScarrs on October 23, 2023, 08:56:23 AMI run a small business and have customers who want to pay in TruefreedomCoins (TFC)Really, you have customers (not singular) who want to pay in TruefreedomCoins or whatever that is?Sorry but I don’t believe you. I’m not sure if there’s an agenda you are trying to push but it’s not welcome. Please don’t shill coins in a non sincere way. If by chance this is genuine then tell them you can’t accept this form of payment. I can’t imagine you will lose much business.

comments.author: Oasisman
comments.body: Quote from: BeautifulScarrs on October 23, 2023, 08:56:23 AMI run a small business and have customers who want to pay in TruefreedomCoins (TFC)What kind of coin is that? Haven't heard of it, probably because there are hundreds of alts in the marker, but if you yourself doesn't even know what it is, then it's better keep your business out of it. If you're interested in accepting crypto payments to your business, then it's always better to just accept bitcoin, ETH, and a few common alts that is widely acceptable in the market today. But that TFC or whatever coin is that doesn't sound like it has a real value. If I assume there's more than one customer who wants to pay with that coin, correct? Encourage them to use bitcoin instead or any top alts that has low tx fees like Ltc.

comments.author: wheelz1200
comments.body: Quote from: BeautifulScarrs on October 23, 2023, 08:56:23 AMHi everyoneI just need some advice. I run a small business and have customers who want to pay in TruefreedomCoins (TFC)I'm searching everywhere but can find a way to get it to pay out.Is there anyone who has experience who can assist.If that is a crypto I would think you wouldn't want to do that.  If you can't find a way to cash out there probably isn't much liquidity to do so and there might be a wild amount of volatility.  Why don't you just offer something much more stable like bitcoin and or litecoin or something of the sort?

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: BeautifulScarrs on October 23, 2023, 08:56:23 AMHi everyoneI just need some advice. I run a small business and have customers who want to pay in TruefreedomCoins (TFC)I'm searching everywhere but can find a way to get it to pay out.Is there anyone who has experience who can assist.Some of these customers requested payment in TruefreedomCoins, for which there are no results I found after searching for it; this indicates that they are scammers and want to exploit the services of your small business for free because they will pay in return a shit unknown token which is likely a scam one that that you will not be able to exchange it because it is not listed on any exchange platforms. Therefore, you should be careful and not accept any unknown or unlisted tokens, and it is better to receive payment through BTC or the TOP altcoins in the market and the stablecoins, as suggested by members here. Also, you should not send your services to them first after completing it; even if they agree with you to receive top tokens, you must implement all the ways to guarantee your rights and make it difficult for others to deceive you.

comments.author: Blitzboy
comments.body: TruefreedomCoins? Wow, really? People are wanting to pay with a coin that sounds a lot like a shitcoin. TFC is a name Im not familiar with even though I've been working with cryptocurrencies for a while. Your desire to please your customers is understandable, but its important to make sure you're not getting lost. Whats the point of going down a road with a coin that is probably not even on trustworthy exchanges?If you're really looking for a way to get TFC to pay out, you should first find out which markets list this coin, if any. Truthfully, you could be falling down a rabbit hole. You could also take mainstream coins if you really want to. We all know them because they're popular. A new coin doesnt have to change your mind. Make sure you stay alert and think carefully about every move you make in this unstable area.
